oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Havel, Edmund (1835-1908)
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Jubilee Singers at the Court of Queen Victoria, 1873
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Group of well dressed young people, some seated, some standing, in a vine-covered portico with a landscape view through arched openings.

This painting depicts the first troupe of a capella singers from Fisk University who traveled raising funds for the Nashville school. This portrait commemorates their performance before Queen Victoria. Painted in 1873 by Edmund Havel, Queen Victoria's court painter, it depicts, left to right (men): Benjamin Holmes, Isaac Dickerson, Thomas Rutling, Edmund Watkins; Left to right (women): Mabel Lewis, Minnie Tate, Ella Sheppard, Jennie Jackson, Julia Jackson, Maggie Porter, Georgia Gordon. George L. White was the director of this group.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Jubilee Singers; African American singers; Fisk University
Making Music
